reviews.text: I travelled for business and had a great experience. The room was spotless and the service was spot-on. I enjoyed breakfast at the hotel and found it to be an excellent representation of Korean and Western food. The fitness center and spa are also not to be missed. I enjoyed opening my window at night so I could hear the sea.
reviews.title: Great Service and Experience

reviews.text: the fnb attendant have a good communication skills. she is hye jin .. you know whenever i went to korea, is very hard to find people speak english and is hard to communicate. whenever i need to order a food i need to use body language . this server know english very well .. hope my future visit the hotel can have more staff can speak English.
reviews.title: good service

reviews.text: I stayed at the Westin Chosun Beach Hotel for a short vacation with my brother, and can highly recommend it to anyone seeking a nice escape for a couple of days. It had impeccable rooms and service (especially on the "executive" floor) and a GREAT gym overlooking the Westin Chosun beach. The hotel restaurants were pricey--$10 for an espresso at the bar?? Give me a break!--but we got a steep discount on the room so didn't complain too much. The hotel is in a great location if you're interested in the beach and nearby restaurants and Buddhist templates. It straddles a small peninsula that has a walking/jogging path and some beautiful views of the beach and Busan bridge. Given the size of the city and heavy traffic I can't say whether the hotel is in the best location for business but it's definitely good for leisure. It would be a great place for a wedding.
reviews.title: Great choice for a visit to Busan

reviews.text: Busan is hard to get around, but when you do get around and arrive at the Chosun Westin you will not be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Very comfortable bed

reviews.text: Upon arrival, you will be swarmed with service. Your baggage is taken to the check in area. It looked crowded but waiting time was minimal.

reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: I've been in a few hotels in my lifetime, but the Westin Chosun tops out as the luxurious. Be forewarned, it is on the pricey side. Due to a booking misunderstanding on my part, I paid more for one night then I had intended, some $235 for a single night. As a solo traveler that put a severe crimp in my personal plans. However, if you're there to get away, relax, enjoy some downtime without worrying too much about budget, this hotel is the place for you. Its decor is tasteful and relaxing. In the lobby/lounge there is live entertainment provided by a pianist, celloist, and occasionally a violinist. The in-house restaurant was very nice and had an abundent selection at the food bar. There is a swimming pool, fitness center, and sauna which I visited personally and was very pleased with. I actually lost my iPod in the locker room and it was returned to me so quickly I hardly knew it was gone. Foreign guests needn't worry about power conversions or being able to simply communicate: the staff speaks very good English and there are power outlets for Western and Korean machinery. The hotel is literally right on the water and able to be enjoyed as your eating or relaxing inside as well. Other than the price tag, I have only two other issues that surfaced: one is the heating. I've read other reviews regarded the heating and cooling of each room. It is uncommonly warm in the bedroom and it doesn't seem to get cooler. My advice is to leave the window open. Also, for those of us who need the internet, access is not free. You have to play by time block to access the net. Other than that, I enjoyed my time at the Westin Chosun and fully plan to return in the future.
reviews.title: Beyond Expectations

reviews.text: We were so impressed by the service we received at the Westin Chosen. My husband and I flew down to Busan for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day with my son who is stationed in near Seoul. When I discovered I left my camera in the cab we took back to the hotel, I contacted the conceirge. Given the name of the cab driver, he was not only able to track down the camera but had it delivered to us as we were enjoying Christmas dinner in the lobby overlooking the beach! It was amazing that this could happen in a city the size of Busan. The room was very clean and comfortable as well. Even though we visited during the winter, we thought the location was great. We spent a lot of time walking through the park on on the beach. This area was bustling yet not too crowded.
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.text: What a great hotel and location. The hotel is right on the beach. We stayed in a room facing the beach and instead of turning the AC, we decided to open the windows so we can hear the waves hitting the shore. It is like camping right on the beach, except that you are staying in a 5 star hotel. Very romantic place. My wife and I had a great time. If we have a chance to go Busan again, this is where we will be staying.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Although Westin's are pricey and this one was no exception, it has a great location and you always know you are going to get great service. We stayed here in Oct 2000 and decided to come back. The Standard King room is a very tight fit especially travelling with 2 small kids. But the other rooms that are bigger do not allow children under the age of 12. Who knows why? The hotel staff was very accomodating in providing a baby crip and rollaway bed for the kids. The view is great and the park behind the hotel is wonderful to explore. Everything is within walking distance. The train is about a 20 minute walk and the restaurants are about a 10 minute walk. There is a Starbucks 5 minutes in either direction. :) If walking isn't your thing, then the conierge is always happy to hail a cab from the cab pool. The pool and fitness center is great and accomodating. The business center is available with free internet. I was disappointed that the hotel didn't have free wireless throughout. I've been at less fancy hotels that cost a whole lot less that had free wireless internet. My overall feeling is very positive and I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Westins are the BEST!

likes.disliked: — The lack of wireless internet and the restrictions on age of children in certain rooms.

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel several times from August to October and I am very sad to say that there always something that didnt work out here. Either the rooms were not available even if I booked 1 month before, or the chair was broken, or there was a whole work out equipment in the room, non-smoking rooms were not available when requested in advance or when they wanted to overchange me for TAX when i am not a korean resident. I udnerstnd this is one of the best hotels in busan yet i am not sure i would recommend to other people. ammenieties/restaurants were alright but most of the time totally overpriced...in august it was extremely difficult to get sleep as the hotel was FULL of families holidaying and the walls are literally made of paper hence extremly noisy until very late. i am really not sure i would clasify this as a business hotel as even the internet connection was a bit of a nightmare
reviews.title: not quite a business hotel....
